org.edgexfoundry.ezmq

Class EZMQSubscriber

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.edgexfoundry.ezmq.EZMQSubscriber

  • public class EZMQSubscriber
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents the EZMQ Subscriber.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  EZMQSubscriber.EZMQSubCallback
      Interface to receive message callback from EZMQ subscriber.

    • Method Detail

      • setClientKeys

        public EZMQErrorCode setClientKeys(java.lang.String clientPrivateKey,
                                   java.lang.String clientPublicKey)
                            throws java.lang.Exception
        Set the security keys of client/its own. Note:
        (1) Key should be 40-character string encoded in the Z85 encoding format
        (2) This API should be called before start() API.
        Parameters:
        clientPrivateKey - Client private/secret key.
        clientPublicKey - Client public key.
        Returns:
        EZMQErrorCode
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Throws, if security is not enabled.

      • setServerPublicKey

        public EZMQErrorCode setServerPublicKey(java.lang.String key)
                                 throws java.lang.Exception
        Set the server public key. Note:
        (1) Key should be 40-character string encoded in the Z85 encoding format
        (2) This API should be called before start() API.
        (3) If using the following API in secured mode:
        EZMQErrorCode subscribe(String ip, int port, String topic); setServerPublicKey API needs to be called before that.
        Parameters:
        key - Server private/Secret key.
        Returns:
        EZMQErrorCode
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Throws, if security is not enabled.

      • start

        public EZMQErrorCode start()
        Starts SUB instance.
        Returns:
        EZMQErrorCode

      • subscribe

        public EZMQErrorCode subscribe()
        Subscribe for event/messages.
        Returns:
        EZMQErrorCode

      • subscribe

        public EZMQErrorCode subscribe(java.lang.String topic)
        Subscribe for event/messages on a particular topic. Note:
        (1) Topic name should be as path format. For example: home/livingroom/
        (2) Topic name can have letters [a-z, A-z], numerics [0-9] and special characters _ - . and /
        (3) Topic will be appended with forward slash [/] in case, if application has not appended it.
        Parameters:
        topic - Topic to be subscribed.
        Returns:
        EZMQErrorCode

      • subscribe

        public EZMQErrorCode subscribe(java.util.List<java.lang.String> topics)
        Subscribe for event/messages on given list of topics. On any of the topic in list, if it failed to subscribe events it will return EZMQ_ERROR/EZMQ_INVALID_TOPIC. Note:
        (1) Topic name should be as path format. For example: home/livingroom/
        (2) Topic name can have letters [a-z, A-z], numerics [0-9] and special characters _ - . and /
        (3) Topic will be appended with forward slash [/] in case, if application has not appended it.
        Parameters:
        topics - List of topics to be subscribed.
        Returns:
        EZMQErrorCode

      • subscribe

        public EZMQErrorCode subscribe(java.lang.String ip,
                               int port,
                               java.lang.String topic)
        Subscribe for event/messages from given IP:Port on the given topic. Note:
        (1) It will be using same Subscriber socket for connecting to given ip:port.
        (2) To un-subscribe use un-subscribe API with the same topic.
        (3) Topic name should be as path format. For example: home/livingroom/
        (4) Topic name can have letters [a-z, A-z], numerics [0-9] and special characters _ - . and /
        (5) Topic will be appended with forward slash [/] in case, if application has not appended it.
        (6) If using in secured mode: Call setServerPublicKey API with target server public key before calling this API.
        Parameters:
        ip - Target[Publisher] IP address.
        port - Target[Publisher] Port number.
        topic - Topic to be subscribed.
        Returns:
        EZMQErrorCode

      • unSubscribe

        public EZMQErrorCode unSubscribe()
        Un-subscribe for all the events from publisher.
        Returns:
        EZMQErrorCode

      • unSubscribe

        public EZMQErrorCode unSubscribe(java.lang.String topic)
        Un-subscribe for a specific topic events. Note:
        (1) Topic name should be as path format. For example: home/livingroom/
        (2) Topic name can have letters [a-z, A-z], numerics [0-9] and special characters _ - . and /
        (3) Topic will be appended with forward slash [/] in case, if application has not appended it.
        Parameters:
        topic - topic to be unsubscribed.
        Returns:
        EZMQErrorCode

      • unSubscribe

        public EZMQErrorCode unSubscribe(java.util.List<java.lang.String> topics)
        Un-subscribe for given list of topic events. On any of the topic in list, if it failed to unsubscribe events it will return EZMQ_ERROR/EZMQ_INVALID_TOPIC. Note:
        (1) Topic name should be as path format. For example: home/livingroom/
        (2) Topic name can have letters [a-z, A-z], numerics [0-9] and special characters _ - . and /
        (3) Topic will be appended with forward slash [/] in case, if application has not appended it.
        Parameters:
        topics - List of topics to be unsubscribed.
        Returns:
        EZMQErrorCode

      • stop

        public EZMQErrorCode stop()
        Stop the SUB instance.
        Returns:
        EZMQErrorCode

        public java.lang.String getIp()
        Get the IP address.
        Returns:
        IP address as String.

        public int getPort()
        Get the port of the subscriber.
        Returns:
